content.description:
Are you guilty of lustful sin for Sedona black varnish, near 'perfect' splitter, and thin trick vert boulder problems? 

  If so...then Saxon Law calls you to court. Trial awaits; Justice by ordeal.   "If innocent, he would pass the test. His flesh would be unharmed."   -Peace Like A River 

  For the guilty... 

  Saxon Justice is a route worth the walk. One for the growing list of Sedona's finest single pitches. A hint of varnish and patina plus some moment of splitter bliss. Thin boulder problem to get you going, some bomber well placed #00 C3s or possibly #000 C3 will help protect the leader. Climb through the black splitter rawness to balancy stances. Thin gear and a helpful hidden fingers piece will get you through the spacey upper boulder problem. Bonkey hand crack to belay ledge. Be mindful of the remaining dinner plates. 

Please be respectful of the project to the right of Saxon. Soon....
content.protection: 2x #000 C3 (helpful low and high)    3x #00 C3    1x #0 C3   1x #1 C3 OPTIONAL   2x #.3 C4   2-3x #.4 C4   2-3x #.5 C4   2-3X #.75 C4   1-2x #1 C4   1x #2 C4 OPTIONAL
content.location: Saxon Justice is found in the scree gully that starts just South of Beef Lord Spire. Approach as you would for Beef Lord Spire. Once you reach the base of Beef Lord look East and up the steep gully towards the obvious clean wall. Follow the North side of the gully until it chokes out and you are forced up the scree towards the base of the route.

content.description:
Best and only warmup! Luckily starts without a crux the moment you leave the ground and gives it to you at the top.  

  Fun climbing in a corner to steep bolts out a bulge.
content.protection: Gear 1-2x Fingers - Fists    Possible to place big cams   4 bolts.   Chain Anchor
content.location: Left side of Tempeh Wall. Starts in obvious corner.

content.description: Double Tap is a high quality mixed line that climbs on the left side of The Tempeh Wall. Start with a powerful boulder problem that ends with a giant move to sloping rail. Do some wild moves, mantle and then move into the splitter crack feature. Clip 2 more bolts and fire the final boulder problem out the bulge near the top.
content.protection: 3 Bolts   Cams #.3- #2 C4s   #4 C4   Runners   Bolted Anchor
content.location: Left side of Tempeh Wall. Start on bolted boulder problem to sloping rails.

content.description: Starts on the Double Tap boulder problem but surfs right into the hanging flare feature. Up through the seams to a exciting crux on top.
content.protection: Several bolts. Single of cams from .2 to #2. Protects well with many options. A very trick but bomber sub tips cam is helpful. A few runners down low.

content.description:
Devotion of sacrifice; Blood over an alter of sand.  

  Blood Ceremony is one of Sedona's most beautiful and difficult splitters.  Nasty sizes and a slight off-set lean makes this a challenging encounter in the realm of splitter cracks.    

  Leave the ground through drifting tips and into the business, punch through some relief and into the final boulder problem. Cruise up into fun and easier terrain. 

  Plea for an end before your veins run dry.
content.protection: Gear Size:   #00 C3 - #3 C4   Few Runners for top
content.location: Right side of Tempeh Wall. You'll know it when you see it.

content.description: The Tempeh Wall is a high quality hang way out in the washes North of Oak Creek Spire. Hosts a small concentration of single pitch lines on quality sandstone.
